cell

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • cell.Entity
      • cell.Projectile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Boss

    public class Projectile
extends Entity
    This data class is used to store the attributes of the moving projectiles in the game (things without health). Features of Version 4.0: This entire class was created to store attributes of projectiles (the miny bacteria, and the boss in the game). The attributes stored are the increments to the x and y positions of the projectile during it's movement. Time spent on this class: 25 min.
    Version:
    5.0, June 12, 2014
    Author:
    Salar Hosseini & Sophia Weng

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int moveX2
      This integer stores the increment in the x position that will be applied to the projectile when it is moving.
      private int moveY2
      This integer stores the increment in the y position that will be applied to the projectile when it is moving.

      This is one of the overloads for the class constructor which accepts four parameters (the x and y positions, and the x and y movements).

        Parameters:
        x - This integer is used to store the x position of the Entity.
        y - This integer is used to store the y position of the Entity.
        moveX - This integer is used to store the increment in the x position of the Entity.
        moveY - This integer is used to store the increment in the Y position of the Entity.
